text.section:
A person may not:
forge, falsify, or counterfeit the signature of a judge, court officer, or court employee of the State; or
use a document with a forged, false, or counterfeit signature of a judge, court officer, or other court employee of the State knowing the signature to be forged, false, or counterfeit.
A person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 5 years or a fine not exceeding $10,000 or both.
A person who violates this section is subject to § 5-106(b) of the Courts Article.
